https://www.shadyoldlady.com/location/10.text: Location: 25 Stoke Newington Common, Hackney Description: The son of a Jewish van driver and caretaker, Bolan grew up as Marc Feld here in post-war Hackney ...
page_text_snippets: Marc Bolan lived here|The Shady Old Lady's Guide to London|Home|»|Tours|»|Categories|Marc Bolan lived here|This is where Marc Bolan lived as a teenage rebel.|Location|: 25 Stoke Newington Common, Hackney|Description|: The son of a Jewish van driver and caretaker, Bolan grew up as Marc Feld here in post-war Hackney in East London with his parents and brother Harry from 1947 to 1962. A plaque marks the house.|At the age of nine, Bolan was given his first guitar and began a skiffle band shortly after. At 14, he was expelled from school. His rebellious streak came out in the wild hair and the often sexual lyrics of the early 1970s star.|As Mark grew up, the front living room was transformed into the boy's bedroom where the brothers spent their time listening to Saturday Night Theatre radio show. A few years later rock'n'roll records replaced BBC radio.|Tours:|Marc Bolan and T-Rex Tour|Themes|:|Music|Marc Bolan lived here|This is where Marc Bolan lived as a teenage rebel.|Ranking This Month|: 1611/3035|Pages Hit This Month|: 13|Credits|: http://www.geocities.com/sunsetstrip/studio/4730/london.htm|Your Comments|:|Name:|Email:|Your email will ONLY be used once, to confirm the publication of your comments.
